H0.text: Chromosomes are the structures that centrioles help organize before cell division so that each daughter cell has the correct number.

H1.text: Ribosomes are the structures that centrioles help organize the chromosomes before cell division so that each daughter cell has the correct number of.

H2.text: Cells are the structures that centrioles help organize the chromosomes before cell division so that each daughter cell has the correct number.

H3.text: Receptors are the components that centrioles help organize the chromosomes before cell division so that each daughter cell has the correct number of them.

A4.text: Centrioles are involved in the organization of the mitotic spindle and in the completion of cytokinesis.

A5.text: However, more recent experiments have demonstrated that cells whose centrioles have been removed via laser ablation can still progress through the G1 stage of interphase before centrioles can be synthesized later in a de novo fashion.

A6.text: Atypical centrioles are centrioles that do not have microtubules

A7.text: Cells without centrosomes lack radial arrays of astral microtubules. They are also defective in spindle positioning and in the ability to establish a central localization site in cytokinesis.

A8.text: When the centrioles are irradiated by a laser, mitosis proceeds normally with a morphologically normal spindle.

A9.text: Centrosomes can form de novo after having been removed from normal cells.

A11.text: Microtubules attach to centromeres and align the chromosomes centrally during cell division.

A12.text: In higher plants, cells lack centrioles; microtubules form a spindle on the surface of the nucleus and are organized into a spindle by the chromosomes themselves.

A13.text: Aurora B is a member of the chromosomal passenger complex and mediates chromosome-microtubule attachment and sister chromatid cohesion.

A14.text: Microtubule polymerization and depolymerization dynamic drive chromosome congression.

A15.text: The mitotic spindle is assembled from the two centrosomes, which contain centrioles, and it organizes chromosomes during cell division.
